sources.title: The Golfers (Andy Clyde Thelma Hill)
sources.description: Mack Sennett's 1929 comedy short (and early talkie) The Golfers starring Andy Clyde, Thelma Hill, Patsy O'Leary, and Harry Gribbon ~ You can learn more about Thelma @ http://www.thelmahill.net

metadata.Plot: Charlie Guest (Charlie Guest) wants to be a golfer. Bert Swor (Bert Swor) is a famous golfer. Thelma Hill (Thelma Hill) only loves the best golfer.Follow Charlie as he tries to become the world's greatest golfer and win Thelma's love. With help from his coach Joe, his marmot and his pals, Charlie will prove the world that he can be a golfer too!Hilarity ensues when Bert also falls for Thelma, challenging Charlie to the world's greatest golf match ever depicted on film.Also, look out for Shemp Howard's cameo as Golfie "The Golfer" Golfenstein, a stoogey man who admires Charlie.
metadata.Writer: John A. Waldron, Phil Whitman, Earle Rodney
metadata.Actors: Andy Clyde, Harry Gribbon, Charlie Guest
